title: "Mexico" stressed casual sans w/ swash 'x'
content:
As close as I can come Iwith the help of WhatTheFont) is Albermarle Swash but it is way off.  
Your help will be appreciated

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080423213154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mx_4059.gif)

 [‹ Boston University Med School Typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20080423213154/http:/typophile.com/node/44531 "Go to previous forum topic") [Mysterious Musical Symbol ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080423213154/http:/typophile.com/node/44528 "Go to next forum topic")
author: link

comments.content: Thanks for the help with my title ...
Hah! :^D You’re welcome — it just wasn’t clear at all what you’re looking for. ;^)

I’m looking for the name of the font that created the word ’mexico’ ... I tried to find it with the help of What The Font however the letters are not recognized. Do I understand correctly that it is two fonts?
it might be custom... at least the swash.
